Docs.summary: Manages an Application Context to the PC/SC Resource Manager.

Docs.remarks: Each thread of an application shall use its own SCardContext.

Docs.summary: Cancels all pending blocking requests on the method.

item.description: An internal communications error has been detected (SCARD_F_COMM_ERROR)

remarks.para: This method calls the API function SCardCancel().

Docs.summary: Checks the validity of the current context.

remarks.para: Call this function to determine whether a smart card context handle is still valid. After a smart card context handle has been set by , it may become not valid if the resource manager service has been shut down.
This method calls the API function SCardIsValidContext().

Docs.remarks: If a context to the PC/SC Resource Manager is established, Dispose() will call the method silently.

Docs.param: Scope of the establishment. This can either be a local or remote connection.
Docs.summary: Creates an Application Context to the PC/SC Resource Manager.

remarks.para: Creates an Application Context for a client. This must be the first WinSCard function called in a PC/SC application. Each thread of an application shall use its own .
This method calls the API function SCardEstablishContext().

Docs.summary: Returns a list of currently available reader groups on the system.
Docs.returns: An array of s containing all Smart Card reader groups found by the PC/SC Resource Manager.

remarks.para: This method calls the API function SCardListReaderGroups().

Docs.summary: Returns a list of currently available readers on the system.
Docs.returns: An array of s containing all Smart Card readers found by the PC/SC Resource Manager.

remarks.para: This method calls the API function SCardListReaders().

Docs.param: List of groups to list readers.
Docs.summary: Returns a list of currently available readers on the system.
Docs.returns: An array of s containing all Smart Card readers found by the PC/SC Resource Manager.

remarks.para: Groups is not used on Linux/UNIX machines using the PC/SC Lite daemon.
This method calls the API function SCardListReaders().

Docs.returns: A that contains the current reader status.

remarks.para: This method uses the method with a of zero.

Docs.summary: Returns the current reader status of all requested readers.
Docs.returns: An array of s that contains the current reader status of each requested reader.

remarks.para: This method uses the method with a of zero.

MemberSignature.Value: public PCSC.SCardError GetStatusChange (IntPtr timeout, PCSC.SCardReaderState[] readerstates);

Docs.param: Maximum waiting time (in milliseconds) for status change, zero or for infinite.
Structures of readers with current states.
Docs.summary: Blocks execution until the current availability of the cards in a specific set of readers changes.

returns.para: A indicating an error or the success.The caller receives status changes through the array.

item.description: The user-specified timeout value has expired (SCARD_E_TIMEOUT)

remarks.para: This method receives a structure or list of structures containing reader names. It then blocks for a change in state to occur for a maximum blocking time of or forever if is used.
The new event state will be contained in . A status change might be a card insertion or removal event, a change in ATR, etc.
To wait for a reader event (reader added or removed) you may use the special reader name "\\?PnP?\Notification". If a reader event occurs the state of this reader will change and the bit will be set.
This method calls the API function SCardGetStatusChange().

Docs.summary: A pointer (Application Context) that can be used for C API calls.
Docs.value: The returned Application Context handle. Is 0 if not context has been established.

remarks.para: This is the Application Context handle that is returned when calling the C API function SCardEstablishContext().

Docs.summary: Checks the validity of the current context.

remarks.para: Call this function to determine whether a smart card context handle is still valid. After a smart card context handle has been set by , it may become not valid if the resource manager service has been shut down.

Docs.summary: Re-Establishes an Application Context to the PC/SC Resource Manager with the last used .
Docs.remarks: This method must not be called before

Docs.summary: Destroys a communication context to the PC/SC Resource Manager.

remarks.para: This must be the last method called in a PC/SC application.
This method calls the API function SCardReleaseContext().
